column4: im having some terrible connection issues, not sure why but every couple of days im not able to goto web pages properly, it go's so slow ..this is not a connection issue i've resolved it with my ISP, so i figured it must be something with Ubuntu. Some things i am able to get to fast like IRC and gAIM .. it doesnt crawl or connect slow.. but webpages do.. any help?
have you turned off IPv6 yet?
im not sure? how do i check
if i dont know i guess i didnt lol
1 sec, lemme find it
ok
in firefox, goto the page "about:config" and in the text box at the top type in "network"
ok did that
then scroll down to network.dns.disableipv6 and double click it to true
it is already on true
rats
no other ideas?
two more, but i dunno how much good it'll do if that's already turned off
well lets try em lol
could it be tmp files cache stuff like that?
maybe, but my first idea: system - admin - network  - DNS  and replace with the two ip address for openDNS (it never hurts)  google for those
hmm PhirePhly , firefox runs fine, but swiftfox does not
is that not weird?
ok
haha, odd.  I've never used swiftfox
i think i may stop now
lol
ill still check out that openDNS PhirePhly
righto
